name: Vegan BBQ hamburger with Mangoraja
bodyParagrps: Thaw Anammas formable mince and mix the bbq sauce.
Shape the mince into 4 burgers. Brush with oil on both sides.
Grill or fry the burgers for about 4-5 minutes on each side. Put the cheese on the burgers and let it melt.
Mangoraja - mix all the ingredients in a bowl, season with salt, pepper and possibly more curry.
Serve the burgers in hamburger buns, with pickled red onion, lettuce, tomatoes and Mangorajan.

name: Tacopizza
bodyParagrps: Dissolve the yeast with lukewarm water.
Add the rest of the ingredients and knead well for a few minutes.
It would be best if the dough is allowed to rise in a bowl large enough with plastic cover in the fridge overnight. At least let the dough rise at room temperature for about 45 minutes.
Flour the dough so it doesn't stick.
Divide it into 4 parts and form into a ball. Leave to rest for about 10 minutes and they will be easier to roll.
Boil the water, add tomato puree and taco seasoning. Let the sauce simmer for 1-2 minutes, turn off the heat and set aside.
Prepare the minced meat. Fry it until it turns brown, add taco seasoning and fry a little more.
Heat the oven to 200°. Roll out a ball into a round pizza and place on a sheet of baking paper.
Brush on tomato sauce, add minced meat and finish with grated cheese.
Bake in the middle of the oven for about 10-13 minutes, until the pizza gets a nice color.
Top with desired vegetables, drizzle with sour cream or crème fraîche.
